014package org.jdbi.v3.core.statement;
015
016import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
017
018/**
019 * describes what should be done if the value passed to {@link SqlStatement#bindList} is null or empty
020 */
021public enum EmptyHandling implements BiConsumer<SqlStatement, String> {
022    /**
023     * <p>Render nothing in the query.</p>
024     * <p>
025     * {@code select * from things where x in ()}
026     */
027    BLANK {
028        @Override
029        public void accept(SqlStatement stmt, String key) {
030            stmt.define(key, "");
031        }
032    },
033    /**
034     * <p>Render the keyword {@code null} in the query, useful e.g. in postgresql where "in ()" is invalid syntax.</p>
035     * <p>
036     * {@code select * from things where x in (null)}
037     */
038    NULL_KEYWORD {
039        @Override
040        public void accept(SqlStatement stmt, String key) {
041            stmt.define(key, "null");
042        }
043    },
044    /**
045     * <p>Define a {@code null} value, leaving the result up to the {@link org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.TemplateEngine} to decide.</p>
046     * <p>
047     * This value was specifically added to <a href="https://github.com/jdbi/jdbi/issues/1377">make conditionals work better with <code>StringTemplate</code></a>.
048     */
049    DEFINE_NULL {
050        @Override
051        public void accept(SqlStatement stmt, String key) {
052            stmt.define(key, null);
053        }
054    },
055    /**
056     * Throw IllegalArgumentException.
057     */
058    THROW {
059        @Override
060        public void accept(SqlStatement stmt, String key) {
061            throw new IllegalArgumentException("argument is null or empty; this is forbidden on this call to `bindList`");
062        }
063    }
064}
